alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 3:52PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rock Island, Scott, southwestern Clinton and northeastern Muscatine Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 350 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Grand Mound to near Montpelier. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, Clinton, East Moline, Eldridge, DeWitt, Milan, Coal Valley, Walcott, Blue Grass, Buffalo, Andalusia, Long Grove, Grand Mound, Calamus, Riverdale, Oak Grove, and Donahue. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 5. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 283 and 304. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
